intro: Mercurialis leiocarpa var. trichocarpa, commonly known as the hairy mercury plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, giving the plant its "hairy" appearance. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. The plant is part of the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
